newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon has $51.3 mln payments surplus in June.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon has $51.3 mln payments surplus in June.

text.p: Lebanon had a $51.3 million balance of payments surplus in June, bringing up mid-year BoP surplus to $38.5 million, the Bank of Lebanon said in its latest monthly bulletin on Tuesday.
The June surplus compared with a $61 million surplus a month earlier.
The Bank said the June surplus resulted from "a rise in net foreign assets of the banks by $26.9 million and a rise in net foreign assets of the central bank by $24.4 million".
"This improvement in the Balance of Payments is due to sustained capital inflows, which largely covered the trade deficit and the monthly foreign exchange requirements of the public sector," it said.
It issued the following balance of payments figures (in millions of dollars):
